opposite_reasoning: Mounting is the clear, direct antonym of Dismounting. Both terms share the same domain (equestrian/vehicle context), same semantic structure (action of changing position relative to a mount/vehicle), but represent opposite directional movements. This binary opposition provides maximum semantic distance while maintaining contextual coherence. The pair is natural, well-established in language, and provides strong contrast for Fisher-LDA centroid separation. While not directly relevant to deception detection, it represents a clean conceptual axis for motion/transition events.
